messages.message: Hey team, I have a sandbox (https://sandbox.console.instabase.com/customer/Engineering/tenant/frag-connector/info) that is up and running. The home page (https://frag-connector.internal.instabase.com/) is loading properly. However, when I try to access deployment manager, it asks me to go through the install process (https://frag-connector.internal.instabase.com/deployment-manager/installer). Does anyone know how could I fix this?
cc @jtau @Ashwin @Kerr Yoo I wonder if you have any insights on what might be going wrong here with Deployment Manager. Thank you!
After resyncing argo, things appear to be working now.

Hey sorry for missing your message. Argo cd / argo cd sandbox related questions should go in <#C058UFAGWTF|>, which I monitor more frequently.

Having the install process appear in DM typically means that one of DM’s environment variables in incorrectly configured. I imagine that when the sandbox was created/updated, the sync must have failed, causing the configuration to be incorrect. A resync with argo, as you performed, would fix the problem.

Currently, we set the ICC state to running if a sync can be started, which is incorrect behavior — the state should be set after the sync succeeds or fails. I’m working on a PR that achieve this right now.
@Kerr Yoo Hey Kerr, after I update the sandbox, the DM is unavailable. After I sync from Arco CD, DM is available but the sandbox is restored to the state before the update.
I created a new thread in <#C058UFAGWTF|>
